item.title: Memory Management in Python
item.author: cognitojayant@gmail.com (Jayant Jha)
item.description: What is Memory Management? Memory management is a procedure by which applications or program to read and write some data from memory. A memory manager determines where to put an application’s data. Since there’s only a finite chunk of memory available to us. This process of giving access to memory to a program or application is by and large called memory allocation. On top of hardware layers such as RAM or a hard drive is the operating system (OS) layer which consists of a Kernel which is the operating system code that is responsible for interaction of hardware and software components.

item.title: About
item.author: cognitojayant@gmail.com (Jayant Jha)
item.description: Summary “It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment” ~ Carl Friedrich Gauss Hey, my name is Jayant Jha currently working as Machine Learning Scientist at a organization EZLab based out of Gurugram, Haryana, India. Given my effort and inquisitiveness to learn and understand, i gets awed by the nature that how little i know.
